description: If a remote call leads to a PolicyNotAuthorized, it gets wrapped in a RemoteError and causes a 500 error.  This should be properly converted to a 401.
title: RemoteErrors with PolicyNotAuthorized need to 401

comments.content:
There are several APIs on master now in Juno catching PolicyNotAuthorized and returning a 403 for it since that's what the parent exception code is.

I think we need more details in the bug report about how to recreate this or where it shows up with the 500, or a stacktrace, so marking as incomplete for now.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Probably the best description is from a comment in this patch:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/4493/

	Vish Ishaya		Feb 24, 2012
Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this
Something is funky here.
The exception should be getting wrapped by ResourceExceptionHandler in nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py:
 573         if isinstance(ex_value, exception.NotAuthorized):
 574             msg = unicode(ex_value)
 575             raise Fault(webob.exc.HTTPForbidden(explanation=msg))
I don't think we want to wrap at compute and volume api layers, we want it wrapped in the wsgi stack where it is.
The problem is that RemoteErrors aren't getting wrapped properly, so what we really need here is another check for Remote error elif isinstance(ex_value, exception.RemoteError) and then a check on the RemoteError to see if it is a NotAuthorized exception of some sort.
This may require RemoteError storing the original type of the exception in an identifiable way. Right now I think it just stores the text from the exception.
At one point I tried to make RemoteErrors reraise the same exception on the calling side, we may be able to do something like that.
